messages.subject: Re: Life-long learning
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 06/12/1999 9:59:39 AM Eastern Daylight Time, Marbleface@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 06/12/1999 9:59:39 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
Marbleface@... writes:

<<
<< I also believe that unschooling continues thru life, even if one
attends college and graduates.
>>
>>
My dad is in his 70's(I can never remember the numbers for any of us!!!my
kids are always correcting me). He wanted to learn to play the violin sohe
called the Institute of Music.They told him he was too old. I got him _Never
Too Late_(John Holt) for his birthday. He decided to learn the recorder and
piano(he bought himself a keyboard).
He now takes classes at the local community college, volunteers at about 4 or
5 different places, goes to the gym 4 times a week, and walks daily.
Debra

messages.subject: Re: Life-long learning
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/12/99 12:29:37 AM !!!First Boot!!!, crma@ix.netcom.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/12/99 12:29:37 AM !!!First Boot!!!, crma@...
writes:

<< I also believe that unschooling continues thru life, even if one
attends college and graduates.
>>

Well, I would hope so! I think this attitude is what has kept my 83 yo Dad
so with-it and fun to be around.

Nance
